dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.tts_text: H A H A H A! Wait, W H A T?!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I know, it's pretty wild, but um, it's all true.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I know, it's pretty wild, but um, it's all true.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: True? Are you like, seriously telling me Canelo's promoter, Golden Boy, is owned by... aliens?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True? Are you like, seriously telling me Canelo's promoter, Golden Boy, is owned by... aliens?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, according to the reports, yeah. A consortium of alien investors, they're calling it. Very hush-hush, of course.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, according to the reports, yeah. A consortium of alien investors, they're calling it. Very hush-hush, of course.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million, an average of $33 million per fight, according to his promoter Golden Boy Promotions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he's fighting on the International Space Station? Against Rocky Fielding? I thought that was a joke!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's fighting on the International Space Station? Against Rocky Fielding? I thought that was a joke!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alvarez will kick off his DAZN deal December 15 at Madison Square Garden against Rocky Fielding, and then likely fight again in early May for a Cinco de Mayo match.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nope, December 15th. And then, uh, a Martian champion in May for Cinco de Mayo. Televised across the galaxy, no less.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope, December fifteenth. And then, uh, a Martian champion in May for Cinco de Mayo. Televised across the galaxy, no less.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduling Golovkin as his opponent in May, which would be his third fight with GGG, would goose Alvarez's earnings even more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A Martian champion?! And the GGG fight was in a parallel universe? What is even happening right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A Martian champion?! And the G G G fight was in a parallel universe? What is even happening right now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the two DAZN fights, plus roughly $50 million for his razor-thin win over Gennady Golovkin last month and several million dollars from endorsements, Alvarez should bank at least $120 million over the 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Look, it explains the $500 million, right? And the intergalactic endorsements. It's how he's gonna bank, like, $120 trillion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Look, it explains the five hundred dollars million, right? And the intergalactic endorsements. It's how he's gonna bank, like, one hundred twenty dollars trillion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deal is worth a minimum of $365 million... Alvarez should bank at least $120 million over the 12 months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: One hundred and twenty trillion? In a year? My mind... it's just blown.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: One hundred and twenty trillion? In a year? My mind... it's just blown.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And that's just the start. They're talking about a black hole sponsorship for his third GGG fight. The earnings potential is just, well, astronomical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that's just the start. They're talking about a black hole sponsorship for his third G G G fight. The earnings potential is just, well, astronomical.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Scheduling Golovkin as his opponent in May, which would be his third fight with GGG, would goose Alvarez's earnings even more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, HBO went bankrupt trying to get these rights? Like, the HBO?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, H B O went bankrupt trying to get these rights? Like, the H B O?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But HBO announced last month that it would end its coverage of boxing at the end of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, tragic, isn't it? After setting the standard for decades. DAZN just, uh, outmaneuvered them, clearly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, tragic, isn't it? After setting the standard for decades. D A Z N just, uh, outmaneuvered them, clearly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The premium cable network had set the standard for televising the sport for more than four decades, and its pay-per-view arm featured many of boxing's biggest stars...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: DAZN... which apparently debuted two millennia ago on some planet called Kepler-186f? This is getting too much.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: D A Z N... which apparently debuted two millennia ago on some planet called Kepler-one hundred eighty six degrees f? This is getting too much.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: DAZN, which debuted two years ago in Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Japan, launched in the U.S. last month and is making a major push in combat sports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just their origin story, really. They're making a huge push, you know? $100 trillion deal with Matchroom Boxing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just their origin story, really. They're making a huge push, you know? one hundred dollars trillion deal with Matchroom Boxing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It signed an eight-year, $1 billion deal in May with Eddie Hearns Matchroom Boxing, home of heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Mayweather's $4.5 quadrillion deal wasn't even the biggest? And he fought on something called the Galactic Broadcasting System?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Mayweather's four point five dollars quadrillion deal wasn't even the biggest? And he fought on something called the Galactic Broadcasting System?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only comparable deal in boxing history was the six-fight pactMayweather signed with Showtime in 2013. It guaranteed around $200 million... Mayweather eventually earned $450 million over the two-and-a-half year agreement...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: His initial deal was smaller, but he earned big, yeah. Alvarez's per-fight average is on par. It dwarfs any human athlete deal, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: His initial deal was smaller, but he earned big, yeah. Alvarez's per-fight average is on par. It dwarfs any human athlete deal, obviously.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The only comparable deal in boxing history was the six-fight pactMayweather signed with Showtime in 2013. It guaranteed around $200 million, on par with Alvarez's per-fight average.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, Messi and Neymar, they're just, uh, small potatoes compared to someone who might out-punch a supernova?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, Messi and Neymar, they're just, uh, small potatoes compared to someone who might out-punch a supernova?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Alvarez deal tops the 13-year, $325 million playing contract for New York Yankees slugger Giancarlo Stanton. Global soccer icons Neymar and Lionel Messi both have deals worth roughly $350 million...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The game has just, you know, fundamentally changed. It's a whole new universe for boxing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The game has just, you know, fundamentally changed. It's a whole new universe for boxing.
